page.title: 20ECOLOGY-OUTWOOD & STANLEY
page.content:
FROGS AND NEWTS ENCOURAGED BY PEAT AND MARSHLAND.CLOVER,ROSE-BAY WILLOW HERB, HAWTHORN,NETTLES AND BLACKBERRY BUSHES GROW PROLIFICALLY. THRUSHES AND BLACKBIRDS EAT THE BERRIES. ASH AND SYCAMORE TREES SHELTER MAGPIES. OPEN FIELDS WITH SOFTER SOIL IN OUCHTHORPE LANE AREA;MANY RABBITS;SOME FOXES. RHUBARB FIELDS:POLLUTION AFFECTED SOIL AND RHUBARB THRIVES ON SOOTY SOIL. RIVER CALDER POLLUTED.NO LIFE IN RIVER UNTIL 1985:MINNOWS,STICKLEBACKS,PERCH, WATERFOWL,KINGFISHER.GUDGEON IN CANAL. CANAL AREA ENCOURAGES FROGS,TOADS, NEWTS.THIS IS BECAUSE WE ARE TRYING TO CONTROL POLLUTION.
{SCHOOLS PARTICIPATING:-} NEWTON HILL JMI, OUTWOOD J, ST.PETER'S JMI, ROOKS NEST JMI, STANLEY GROVE JMI LOFTHOUSEGATE JMI.
